content: The Act may be cited as the "Community Development Block Grant Renewal Act" and includes a requirement for targeting low- and moderate-income individuals. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to increase assistance to low-income families, with at least 40 percent of funds directly benefiting persons of low income. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to increase assistance to low-income families, with a requirement that 80 percent of funds support activities benefiting persons of low and moderate income, and 40 percent specifically benefit persons of low income. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to prioritize assistance for low-income individuals, with a focus on persons of low income in downtown areas. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to prioritize assistance for low-income individuals, with a focus on persons of low income in downtown areas. The amendment specifies that activities serving non-residential areas generally will not be considered to primarily benefit low or moderate-income individuals. Additionally, in determining the benefits of assisted activities for low and moderate-income individuals, the grantee must consider the full range of direct effects of the activity. SEC. 3. PROPORTIONAL TREATMENT OF BENEFIT FOR LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME FAMILIES. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for low-income individuals in development and economic activities. Additionally, area benefit activities are also amended to ensure proportional treatment for low- and moderate-income families. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for low-income individuals in development and economic activities. Area benefit activities are also amended to ensure proportional treatment for low- and moderate-income families. The amendment includes inserting clauses to specify the extent of benefits for low and moderate-income persons in assisted activities. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for low-income individuals in housing and job creation activities. The changes involve expanding eligibility for new construction, rehabilitation, and job creation, with a focus on ensuring housing units are occupied by low-income individuals. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for low-income individuals in housing and job creation activities. Any assisted activity benefiting low or moderate income individuals will be considered to benefit them for compliance purposes. SEC. 4. PUBLIC PARTICIPATION. Amends the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 to define 'public hearing' in accordance with state and local laws. SEC. 5. PUBLIC MONITORING. Section 105(a) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provision of assistance to nonprofit organizations for monitoring fund use and promoting public participation. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include assistance to nonprofit organizations for monitoring fund use and promoting public participation, including administrative costs and public services. The amendments made by this Act apply to fiscal year 2002 and all subsequent fiscal years for community development block grants under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974.
